Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: a person involved in the conversations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out. After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn’t agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Hours after Mr. Altman was ousted, OpenAI executives confronted the remaining board members during a video call, according to three people who were on the call.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: three people who were on the call

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: On Sunday, Mr. Sutskever was urged at OpenAI’s office to reverse course by Mr. Brockman’s wife, Anna, according to two people familiar with the exchange.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: two people familiar with the exchange

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft, which asked him to lead an A.I. lab with Greg Brockman, who quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman.
Hours later, he signed a letter with other employees that demanded the independent directors resign.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn’t “consistently candid in his communications with the board.”
Document Sources.Source Justification: The statement he read to Mr. Altman

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Sam Altman called an OpenAI board member’s research paper a danger to the company weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Sam Altman called an OpenAI board member’s research paper a danger to the company weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: At one point, Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The news that he was being pushed out came in a videoconference on Friday afternoon, when Mr. Sutskever, who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years, read him a statement.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Mr. Sutskever, who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years, read him a statement.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Those tensions seemingly came to an end late Tuesday when Mr. Altman was reinstated as chief executive.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Those tensions seemingly came to an end late Tuesday when Mr. Altman was reinstated as chief executive.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Among the tensions leading up to Mr. Altman’s ouster and quick return involved his conflict with Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: A few weeks before Mr. Altman’s firing, he met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: During the call, Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,” and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,” and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: At 5:15 a.m. on Monday, he posted on X, formerly Twitter, that “I deeply regret my participation in the board’s actions.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: At 5:15 a.m. on Monday, he posted on X, formerly Twitter, that “I deeply regret my participation in the board’s actions.”

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
